title: Dynamic heterostructure design of MnO2 for high-performance aqueous zinc-ion batteries
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, 17,3629-3640
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE00341A, Paper
Xiaoru Zhao, Feng Zhang, Houzhen Li, Huitong Dong, Chuncheng Yan, Chao Meng, Yuanhua Sang, Hong Liu, Yu-Guo Guo, Shuhua Wang
Bi12.53Mn0.47O19.85 (BiO), acting as a metal ion reservoir, can supply Bi3+ to R-MnO2in situ to form Bi2Mn4O10 (BMO) during cycling, resulting in dynamic transformation from the BiO/MnO2 heterostructure to the BMO/MnO2 heterostructure.
